In [[1966]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien|a letter]] to Charles Calleja'''.<ref>{{webcite|author=Kristina Chetcuti|articleurl=http://www.timesofmalta.com/articles/view/20121224/local/A-quest-for-The-Hobbit.450767|articlename=A quest for ''The Hobbit''|dated=24 December 2012|website=[http://www.timesofmalta.com/ TimesofMalta.com]|accessed=6 March 2014}}</ref>

*'''Contents:''' Tolkien explained that the second edition [[The Hobbit|''Hobbit'']] was different to the original.
*'''Description:''' Typewritten letter with handwritten annotations, 2 pages, Oxford.
*'''Publication:''' None. 

== Excerpts ==

“Being influenced by, or making use of, events or experience of one’s life (which is inevitable) has nothing to do with allegory.”

“You will not find it possible, I think, to acquire a copy of the first edition... they are very scarce, most of the stocks having perished in the London blitz.”

{{references}}
